[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: freeze_incentive_pool()] [Vector Append] Line 269 appends new_inactive_pools to inactive_objs; if inactive_objs already contains duplicates, could this cause same pool to appear multiple times in inactive list? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: freeze_incentive_pool()] [Active Pool Loss] After freezing, pool_objs only contains pools with phase >= deadline; could legitimate active pools with phase just below deadline be incorrectly frozen, preventing ongoing rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Time Manipulation] Lines 420-421 adjust start_at to pool.last_update_at if latter is greater, but what if attacker manipulates clock to make current_timestamp < last_update_at, causing negative time_diff? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Division by Zero] At line 436, if supply=0, index_increase calculation is skipped, but what if supply becomes 0 after pool starts? Could existing index_reward become stale and never update? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Precision Loss] Line 436 performs (rate_ms * time_diff) / supply; if supply is very large, could integer division truncate rewards to zero for small holders? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Overflow Risk] Line 452 calculates (index_reward - index_rewards_paid) * user_balance; if user_balance is near u256::MAX, could multiplication overflow? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Negative Index] If index_rewards_paid > index_reward due to race condition, line 452 would underflow; is there protection against this? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_one()] [Reward Accumulation] Line 453 adds reward_increase to total_rewards_of_user; could repeated calls without claiming cause total_rewards to exceed total_supply, enabling reward inflation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_release_rate()] [Division by Zero] Lines 459-462 divide total_supply by (end_at - start_at); if create_incentive_pool() allows start_at=end_at despite check at line 217, could this cause division by zero? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_release_rate()] [Ray Precision] ray_div at line 459 returns value in RAY (1e27) precision; could overflow occur when multiplying this rate by time_diff in calculate_one()? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_user_effective_amount()] [Factor Edge Case] Lines 465-483 calculate effective amount as supply - factor*borrow; if factor=0, all borrow is ignored; is this intended or could it be exploited? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_user_effective_amount()] [Ray Multiplication] Line 477 uses ray_mul(factor, borrow_balance); if factor is not in RAY format (1e27), could this produce incorrect effective_borrow_balance? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_user_effective_amount()] [Underflow Protection] Lines 478-480 check supply > effective_borrow before subtraction; but if effective_borrow > supply, function returns 0; could this zero out rewards for users with high borrow utilization? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: calculate_user_effective_amount()] [Borrow/Supply Swap] Lines 467-470 swap supply and borrow for borrow option; could incorrect option value cause wrong balance to be used in reward calculation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [Version Check] Line 380 calls version_verification but update_reward is called from multiple paths; if version is outdated, could stale reward data be written? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [Total Supply Confusion] Lines 386-389 swap total_supply with total_borrow for borrow option; but what if storage returns wrong values, could this cause incorrect reward distribution? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [Loop Optimization] Lines 392-415 iterate through all matching pools; if pool_objs is very large (1000+), could this cause gas exhaustion and DOS? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [Table Operations] Lines 404-412 remove then add entries to index_rewards_paids and total_rewards_of_users; is this remove-then-add pattern necessary or could direct update reduce gas? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [Stale Index] Pool.last_update_at updated to now at line 402; but if now < pool.end_at and pool expires before next update, could rewards be lost? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward()] [User Balance Zero] If user_supply_balance and user_borrow_balance are both zero at line 385, calculate_user_effective_amount returns 0; could new user miss rewards earned before first deposit? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward_all()] [Multiple Updates] Lines 372-377 call update_reward 4 times for different options; could this quadruple gas cost and enable DOS if attacker forces frequent updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: update_reward_all()] [Option Overlap] If same pool matches multiple options, update_reward_all updates it 4 times; could this cause reward over-accumulation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Entry Function] Line 272 is entry function calling base_claim_reward; if sender transfers their position before claim completes, could rewards be lost? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/lending_core/sources/incentive_v2.move] [Function: base_claim_reward()] [Closed Pool Check] Lines 306-309 skip pools where now > closed_at, but continue without reverting; could attacker drain funds by claiming from unclosed pools even if most are closed?
